# Data Science in Education

## Data Science in Education {.smaller}

```{r}
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)

# Create a data frame with the comparison data
comparison_data <- data.frame(
  Criteria = c("Focus", "Primary Users", "Data Sources", "Main Objectives"),
  Learning_Analytics = c(
    "Individual learner's educational process",
    "Learners, instructors, educational practitioners",
    "Learning management systems (LMS), online interactive platforms, educational applications",
    "Improve educational outcomes, personalize learning experiences, identify learning difficulties"
  ),
  Academic_Analytics = c(
    "Institution-wide educational processes",
    "Educational institutions, administrators, academic officers",
    "Institutional databases, student information systems, academic performance data",
    "Enhance academic program quality, optimize resource allocation, track institutional performance"
  ),
  Policy_Analytics = c(
    "Education policy and its social/economic impact",
    "Policy makers, government agencies, education authorities",
    "Large-scale educational data sets, government and institutional reports, public data sources",
    "Inform and guide policy decisions, assess policy impacts, support strategic planning"
  )
)

# Generate the HTML table with kable
kable(comparison_data, "html") %>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed"), full_width = F,
                font_size = 25) %>%
  column_spec(1, bold = TRUE, border_right = TRUE) %>%
  row_spec(0, bold = TRUE, background = "#D3D3D3")

```

![](images/PA.png){width="70%"}

# Data Science Process

-   Data Science Process is a framework for solving problems using data science.

-   Data Science Process has 5 steps such as:

    -   Problem/Context Understanding
    -   Data Understanding and Collection
    -   Data Preprocessing
    -   Modeling & Evaluating
    -   Deployment
